name: SELECT
shortDescription: Retrieve data from one or more tables
description: The SELECT statement retrieves rows from Elasticsearch indices. It supports most standard SQL features including joins, aggregations, and subqueries.

examples.title: Simple select
examples.description: Select all columns with a filter

examples.title: Select with aggregation
examples.description: Group by department and compute statistics
examples.sql:
SELECT department, COUNT(*) as count, AVG(salary) as avg_salary
FROM employees
GROUP BY department

examples.title: Select with join
examples.sql:
SELECT o.id, c.name
FROM orders o
JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id = c.id

examples.title: Select with ordering and limit
examples.sql:
SELECT name, created_at
FROM products
ORDER BY created_at DESC
LIMIT 10

notes: Elasticsearch has a default limit of 10,000 documents per query
Use scroll/search_after for large result sets
Nested fields require special handling with UNNEST
